task_summary: Perceive a T-shaped block, align the tool, and push it toward a marked target outline using two pushes with intermediate re-alignment, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop pushing task with a UR-style arm: the robot must push a T-shaped block across a white surface into a fixed target region drawn on the table. The sequence begins with visual detection of the block and the target outline. The end-effector aligns its yaw to push along the desired direction, executes a coarse push to traverse most of the distance, refines alignment, and performs a short corrective push to settle the block near the goal outline. After motion completion, the robot waits briefly and retreats to clear the view for verification.
preconditions: Workspace clear; block and target outline visible
End-effector free of obstructions; table friction approximately known
stepwise_plan: Detect the T-block and detect the target outline.
Approach and align to the block with coarse tolerance.
Set yaw for push direction toward the target.
Execute a coarse push of 0.2 m toward the target.
Re-align with tighter tolerance near the goal.
Execute a fine push of 0.1 m to settle at the target.
success_criteria: Block lies inside or overlapping the target outline
Block orientation acceptable for the outline tolerance
Robot ends in a safe, non-contact pose
failure_and_recovery: Perception miss or occlusion → retry detection (decorator).
Block slips/rotates unexpectedly → re-align and perform shorter push.
Overshoot beyond target → re-detect and push back with opposite direction.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after final wait if pushing actions succeed and no further retries are requested.

frame_3.now_evidence: Tool aligned near the block indicating ready-to-push configuration.
frame_3.predicts_next: Coarse push initiation is expected immediately after alignment.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Detect the T-shaped block in the workspace.
Detect the goal outline on the table.
Coarsely approach and align the tool to the block.
Orient the tool yaw to push toward the target.
Fine push to settle inside the target.

failure_modes: Slip or unintended rotation during push
recovery_strategy: Re-align with tighter tolerance and repeat fine push
assumptions: Frames show a red T block and blue outline target; instruction mentions gray block and green target with blue end-effector. We prioritize visual evidence.
Direction_deg=90 assumed to point from block toward the outline in the camera/table frame.
10Hz observation/control implied; library exposes only timeout bins, so timeouts snapped to {400,800,1200,1500} ms.

expected_success_criteria: Block centroid lies within target outline bounds with small orientation error
